question: Is TMEM27 (collectrin) specifically expressed on pancreatic beta cells, making it a reliable surface marker to distinguish beta cells from other cell types? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Here, we report the identification and characterization of transmembrane protein 27 (Tmem27, collectrin) in pancreatic beta cells.
content.source_2: In single-cell RNA sequencing of adult human pancreatic tissue, TMEM27 transcripts were sparse in insulin-positive beta cells and instead prominent in ductal and acinar compartments, arguing against its use as a beta cell marker.
content.source_3: This cleavage process is beta cell specific and does not occur in other cell types.
content.source_4: Contrary to prior reports, transgenic mice engineered to overexpress Tmem27 specifically in pancreatic beta cells did not exhibit an increase in beta cell mass over a 12-week period, and comparable Tmem27 immunoreactivity was detected in neighboring alpha cells.
